catalog_info.title: Biological Impostors: Mimicry and Camouflage in Nature
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Plants and animals imitate one another and their surroundings to escape notice and avoid predators. This seminar explores the evolution of mimicry and camouflage using case studies that reveal the range of visual, behavioral, acoustical, and chemical means by which this deception is accomplished.
